message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CC 

This paper deals with natural language processing (NLP) tasks, specifically recognizing semantic relations between terms. The paper discusses the use of path-based and distributional information sources, which are commonly used in NLP. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses neural methods, which are commonly used in machine learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the effectiveness of the method, which falls under the scope of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also discusses the analysis of the cases, which falls under the scope of cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
